pullrequest.title: [gz11] Use XML elements instead of attributes to fit SDF spec

content.raw:
Imagine there is a `<delphyne-gui>` that can load this plugin where you would want:

```
<plugin filename="">
    <ignition-gui>....</ignition-gui>
    <delphyne-gui>...</delphyne-gui>
   
    all the plugin specific parameters
</plugin>
```

If the plugin specific parameters are at the same level as `ignition-gui`, then it's more difficult to extend the contents of the `<plugin>` element. Do something like:

```
<plugin filename="">
    <ignition-gui>....</ignition-gui>
    <delphyne-gui>...</delphyne-gui>
   <parameters>
        all the plugin specific parameters
    </parameters>
</plugin>
```

Is more future proof.
content.html:
Imagine there is a <delphyne-gui> that can load this plugin where you would want:

<plugin filename="">
    <ignition-gui>....</ignition-gui>
    <delphyne-gui>...</delphyne-gui>

    all the plugin specific parameters
</plugin>

If the plugin specific parameters are at the same level as ignition-gui, then it's more difficult to extend the contents of the <plugin> element. Do something like:

<plugin filename="">
    <ignition-gui>....</ignition-gui>
    <delphyne-gui>...</delphyne-gui>
   <parameters>
        all the plugin specific parameters
    </parameters>
</plugin>

Is more future proof.
